content:
I finished my undergraduate at Harbin Engineering University (HEU), where I learned how to become an engineer. I am a master student who graduated from Southeast University in 2022, where I learned how to become a researcher. I am currently working as a system engineer in Huawei Co. Ltd, working in the field of millimeter wave radar applications.
Influenced by my father since I was a child, I am very interested in science and have grown up in practice.When I was in college, I read a lot of books about science and technology to increase my knowledge and broaden my horizons.In my spare time, I participated in many electronic design competitions and got good results.
summary: I finished my undergraduate at Harbin Engineering University (HEU), where I learned how to become an engineer. I am a master student who graduated from Southeast University in 2022, where I learned how to become a researcher.
title: Jiawang Li

content:
Click on the Slides button above to view the built-in slides feature. Slides can be added in a few ways:
Create slides using Wowchemy‚Äôs Slides feature and link using slides parameter in the front matter of the talk file Upload an existing slide deck to static/ and link using url_slides parameter in the front matter of the talk file Embed your slides (e.g. Google Slides) or presentation video on this page using shortcodes. Further event details, including page elements such as image galleries, can be added to the body of this page.
summary: An example talk using Wowchemy's Markdown slides feature.
title: Example Talk

authors: Wei Hong, Yun Hu, Huimin Liu, Gang Xu, Yuanwei Zhu, Zongyu Zhang and Zhenyu Pan
summary: A mmWave dual polarized antenna with filtering response and low cross polarization for 5G mobile communication is proposed. It not only avoids the use of additional filters which will bring some insertion loss and increase circuit board area, but also achieves very low cross polarization characteristic. In addition, the antenna has a simple structure which makes manufacturing easier. The proposed antenna and array can be a competitive candidate for 5G practical applications.
title: Design and Implementation of mmWave Phased-array Radar for Three-dimensional Imaging

content:
Based on the Txx millimeter-wave radar platform, systematically analyzed the points formed within the human body by the millimeter-wave MIMO radar with the increase in the number of channels and the change in the number of solution angles under different angles, different distances, and different attitudes of the human body point cloud Quantity Benefit Analysis.
The figure shows only the change in the number of point clouds formed by static and moving human bodies under the current signal processing flow. From the results, it can be seen that moving targets can bring about an increase in the number of detected targets in the Doppler dimension. Provide more target point clouds.
summary: A systematic conclusion analysis about indoor human activity.
title: Benefit Analysis of Multi-Channel Radar Angular Resolution Based on Txx platform

summary: In this article, a 2-D 16-beam MBAA with 16 √ó 16 SIW Butler matrix and a 2-D APHMBAA with an orthogonal beamforming architecture are proposed, designed, and demon strated. Their properties indicate that the two 2-D MBAA could both provide the most promising candidates for the next-generation mobile communication system.
title: 2-D Orthogonal Multibeam Antenna Arrays for 5G Millimeter-Wave Applications

authors: Yun Hu, Lei Xiang, Weiyang Kong and Wei Hong
summary: Wide impedance bandwidth, 3 dB AR bandwidth, and 3 dB gain bandwidth are the advantages of the proposed antenna, so it can be a good candidate for 5G mmWave and K or Ka satellite communication applications.
title: Broadband Circularly Polarized Magnetoelectric Dipole Antenna and Array for K-Band and Ka-Band Satellite Communications

content: A highly integrated millimeter-wave radar imaging system based on L-shaped antenna array is proposed and implemented.The system is based on the frequency modulation continuous wave phased array system, and consists of a frequency sweep source, a transmitting and receiving link, and a beamforming antenna with the function of transmitting and receiving switching.The antenna adopts a microstrip antenna, and the unit is designed to have a wide beam pattern, which is convenient for wide-angle scanning during the line array scanning process.When the radar system is working, first use the phase shifter of the transmitting channel in the beamforming chip to deflect the beam at a specific angle, and then the receiving link traverses through scanning N beams to find the target, and the echo data at this time is 1√óN In the form of a matrix, the direction of the transmitting beam is changed until the entire imaging target is searched, and the received intermediate frequency reflects the distance information of the imaging target.With the wide application of millimeter-wave beamforming chips, compared with imaging systems using multi-beam systems, too many radio frequency channels and baseband ADCs are saved, and the overall integration level is improved. While ensuring a certain imaging accuracy , which greatly reduces the imaging cost.
summary: A highly integrated millimeter-wave radar imaging system based on an L-shaped antenna array.
title: L-Shape Highly Integrated Millimeter wave Phased Array Imaging System

authors: Yun Hu, Lei Xiang, Guangwen Jin, Zhenyu Pan and Hong Wei
summary: In this paper, a filtenna with only 4-layers metals for 5G mmWave application is proposed. A simple but effective way of feeding and radiation makes the design simple and increases the practical value of the antenna. The filtenna is a good candidate for mmWave 5G applications.
title: Millimeter Wave Filtenna with Compact Size for 5G Applications

authors: Lei Xiang, Yun Hu and Wei Hong
summary: A mmWave dual polarized antenna with filtering response and low cross polarization for 5G mobile communication is proposed. It not only avoids the use of additional filters which will bring some insertion loss and increase circuit board area, but also achieves very low cross polarization characteristic. In addition, the antenna has a simple structure which makes manufacturing easier. The proposed antenna and array can be a competitive candidate for 5G practical applications.
title: Dual polarized Antenna and Array with Filtering Response and Low Cross Polarization for 5G Millimeter Wave Applications

authors: Yun Hu, Lei Xiang, Zhi Hui Ma and Hong Wei
summary: A mmWave broadband CP stacked antenna is proposed. The CP bandwidth of the antenna can be broadened by utilizing 4 driven patches and one radiation patch. The antenna provides a promising solution for mmWave 5G application.
title: Millimeter Wave Broadband Circularly Polarized Antenna and Array with Stacked Structure

content: A wide bandwidth angular scanning phased array antenna array working in 24.25~29.5GHz is proposed.The antenna is based on the mixed mode of monopole antenna and microstrip antenna, adding a symmetrical monopole antenna around the traditional microstrip antenna, extending the previous ¬±45¬∞ scan to ¬±60¬∞.At the same time, in order to achieve miniaturization, on the basis of not affecting the performance of the antenna, the size of the antenna unit is set to 4mm√ó4mm, and the polarization isolation under the same unit can reach 20dB.At the same time, in order to further improve the isolation between units and avoid the occurrence of scanning blind spots, the defect-in-ground (DGS) technology is adopted to effectively remove the scanning blind spots in the band.As a verification, an 8√ó8 scale highly integrated phased array antenna array using beamforming chip phase shifting was designed and tested. The whole board achieves a wide operating bandwidth by laying out two different stacked SICL power splitters. Ensures uniformity of power reaching the chip while also ensuring high isolation between the two polarizations.The entire antenna aperture including the surrounding dummy elements is only 4cm√ó4cm, the measured antenna scanning angle can reach ¬±60¬∞, and it works in the 5G millimeter wave frequency band, which is very suitable for broadband millimeter wave communication systems such as small base stations.
summary: A small dual-polarization phased array system operating at 24.25~29.5GHz for mmWave base stations.
title: Miniaturized Millimeter wave Base Station Platform

content: Aiming at the insertion loss problem caused by the filter in the millimeter wave transceiver, a millimeter wave filter antenna and a related phased array antenna design based on a single mode resonator are proposed.The average gain of the simulated antenna is 5.5dBi, and the actual measurement and simulation are in good agreement. The upper sideband suppression of the antenna exceeds 30dB, and the lower sideband suppression exceeds 10dB. The antenna has a steeper cut-off frequency band.Compared with other types of filter antennas, the filter antennas designed in this chapter have a simpler structure, more radiation nulls, relatively fewer stacks and lower cost, higher upper sideband rejection, lower profile, and lower cost. The wide working bandwidth basically covers the 24.25~29.5GHz 5G millimeter wave frequency band at home and abroad, and has high application value.In order to verify the scanability of the antenna based on the single-mode resonator filter,A 4√ó4 antenna array is designed through the combination of beamforming chips and antennas, and two voltage regulators and 4 beamforming chips are integrated on the board. Each forming chip contains 4 channels, each Each channel is connected to the corresponding antenna unit, and a circle of dummy elements are placed around the active antenna array, and each dummy element is connected to a 50-ohm matching resistor to simulate the surrounding environment of the antenna. Divider, the power divider has a 100 ohm resistor connected to the internal blind hole soldering to achieve good isolation between channels.The antenna test is directly obtained by using a network analyzer. One port is connected to the test antenna, and the other port is connected to the standard horn antenna (21.7~33GHz). The gain of the standard horn antenna in the band is basically stable. When calibrating the phased array beam pointing, 26GHz is used for calibration Center, so the filter characteristics of the antenna under test can be obtained directly.This filtering characteristic combines the filtering characteristics of the antenna itself, the gain unbalance characteristic between different channels of the chip, the gain drop characteristic of the chip on both sides of the frequency band, and the gain drop characteristic caused by the inconsistency of the frequency band of the receiving speaker.The large gain fluctuation in the band is mainly due to the inductive or capacitive output impedance of the chip. When it is connected with the relatively sudden impedance of the filter antenna, it is easy to cause a large impedance mismatch at some frequencies, resulting in a large jitter in the band. . The gain trend of the active filter antenna array is basically the same as that of the chip gain, indicating that the final in-band filtering characteristics of the array mainly depend on the gain flatness of the chip.
summary: A simple and easy-to-integrate millimeter-wave filter antenna and integrated array.
title: Filtenna and filtenna array based on single mode resonator

content:
The first type of antenna is based on short-circuit via loading, which disturbs the current distribution on the surface of the driven patch at the bottom side band, and introduces a filter antenna with additional zero points.Covering the 24.25~29.5GHz 5G millimeter wave broadband communication frequency band.It has the characteristics of broadband, low profile, simple structure, and multiple radiation nulls, and is very suitable for 5G millimeter wave broadband communication applications.
The second filter antenna is based on a single-layer PCB structure that strategically adjusts the position of the feed point to excite a directional pattern of radiation in-band, while the pattern generated out-of-band can well make the The electric fields cancel each other out, basically no radiation is formed to the outside.
summary: A filtenna based on stacked patches and a filtenna based on single-layer PCB.
title: Stacked patches filtenna and single-layer filtenna

content:
import libr print('hello') Overview The Wowchemy website builder for Hugo, along with its starter templates, is designed for professional creators, educators, and teams/organizations - although it can be used to create any kind of site The template can be modified and customised to suit your needs. It‚Äôs a good platform for anyone looking to take control of their data and online identity whilst having the convenience to start off with a no-code solution (write in Markdown and customize with YAML parameters) and having flexibility to later add even deeper personalization with HTML and CSS You can work with all your favourite tools and apps with hundreds of plugins and integrations to speed up your workflows, interact with your readers, and much more Get Started üëâ Create a new site üìö Personalize your site üí¨ Chat with the Wowchemy community or Hugo community üê¶ Twitter: @wowchemy @GeorgeCushen #MadeWithWowchemy üí° Request a feature or report a bug for Wowchemy ‚¨ÜÔ∏è Updating Wowchemy? View the Update Tutorial and Release Notes Crowd-funded open-source software To help us develop this template and software sustainably under the MIT license, we ask all individuals and businesses that use it to help support its ongoing maintenance and development via sponsorship.
‚ù§Ô∏è Click here to become a sponsor and help support Wowchemy‚Äôs future ‚ù§Ô∏è As a token of appreciation for sponsoring, you can unlock these awesome rewards and extra features ü¶Ñ‚ú®
Ecosystem Hugo Academic CLI: Automatically import publications from BibTeX Inspiration Check out the latest demo of what you‚Äôll get in less than 10 minutes, or view the showcase of personal, project, and business sites.
Features Page builder - Create anything with widgets and elements Edit any type of content - Blog posts, publications, talks, slides, projects, and more! Create content in Markdown, Jupyter, or RStudio Plugin System - Fully customizable color and font themes Display Code and Math - Code highlighting and LaTeX math supported Integrations - Google Analytics, Disqus commenting, Maps, Contact Forms, and more! Beautiful Site - Simple and refreshing one page design Industry-Leading SEO - Help get your website found on search engines and social media Media Galleries - Display your images and videos with captions in a customizable gallery Mobile Friendly - Look amazing on every screen with a mobile friendly version of your site Multi-language - 34+ language packs including English, ‰∏≠Êñá, and Portugu√™s Multi-user - Each author gets their own profile page Privacy Pack - Assists with GDPR Stand Out - Bring your site to life with animation, parallax backgrounds, and scroll effects One-Click Deployment - No servers. No databases. Only files. Themes Wowchemy and its templates come with automatic day (light) and night (dark) mode built-in. Alternatively, visitors can choose their preferred mode - click the moon icon in the top right of the Demo to see it in action! Day/night mode can also be disabled by the site admin in params.toml.
Choose a stunning theme and font for your site. Themes are fully customizable.
License Copyright 2016-present George Cushen.
Released under the MIT license.
summary: Welcome üëã We know that first impressions are important, so we've populated your new site with some initial content to help you get familiar with everything in no time.
title: Welcome to Wowchemy, the website builder for Hugo

content: For 5G millimeter wave broadband wireless communication and K-band and Ka-band satellite communication,Proposed and designed a millimeter-wave broadband circularly polarized electromagnetic dipole antenna, based on the traditional linearly polarized electromagnetic dipole,the electric dipole element and the magnetic dipole element are respectively modified, and an additional magnetic dipole element is introduced, which not only increases the 3dB axial ratio bandwidth of the antenna unit, but also greatly increases the -10dB impedance bandwidth of the antenna.At the same time, in order to improve the antenna gain, a 4√ó4 antenna array is jointly designed by using a broadband power distribution network.The antenna array is processed and tested, and the test results are in good agreement with the simulation results, which verifies the correctness of the design.The proposed antenna array has the advantages of broadband (impedance bandwidth, 3dB axial ratio bandwidth, 3dB gain bandwidth), low profile, low processing cost, simple structure, flexible design method, etc., and is very suitable for applications such as millimeter wave broadband satellite communication systems.
summary: A mmWave broadband circularly polarized electromagnetic dipole antenna array and a mmWave broadband stacked patch array.
title: Millimeter Wave Broadband Circularly Polarized Antenna

content:
Wowchemy is designed to give technical content creators a seamless experience. You can focus on the content and Wowchemy handles the rest.
Highlight your code snippets, take notes on math classes, and draw diagrams from textual representation.
On this page, you‚Äôll find some examples of the types of technical content that can be rendered with Wowchemy.
Examples Code Wowchemy supports a Markdown extension for highlighting code syntax. You can customize the styles under the syntax_highlighter option in your config/_default/params.yaml file.
```pythonimport pandas as pddata = pd.read_csv("data.csv")data.head()```renders as
import pandas as pd data = pd.read_csv("data.csv") data.head() Mindmaps Wowchemy supports a Markdown extension for mindmaps.
Simply insert a Markdown markmap code block and optionally set the height of the mindmap as shown in the example below.
A simple mindmap defined as a Markdown list:
```markmap {height="200px"}- Hugo Modules- wowchemy- wowchemy-plugins-netlify- wowchemy-plugins-netlify-cms- wowchemy-plugins-reveal```renders as
- Hugo Modules- wowchemy- wowchemy-plugins-netlify- wowchemy-plugins-netlify-cms- wowchemy-plugins-reveal A more advanced mindmap with formatting, code blocks, and math:
```markmap- Mindmaps- Links- [Wowchemy Docs](https://wowchemy.com/docs/)- [Discord Community](https://discord.gg/z8wNYzb)- [GitHub](https://github.com/wowchemy/wowchemy-hugo-themes)- Features- Markdown formatting- **inline** ~~text~~ *styles*- multilinetext- `inline code`-```jsconsole.log('hello');console.log('code block');```- Math: $x = {-b \pm \sqrt{b^2-4ac} \over 2a}$```renders as
- Mindmaps- Links- [Wowchemy Docs](https://wowchemy.com/docs/)- [Discord Community](https://discord.gg/z8wNYzb)- [GitHub](https://github.com/wowchemy/wowchemy-hugo-themes)- Features- Markdown formatting- **inline** ~~text~~ *styles*- multilinetext- `inline code`-```jsconsole.log('hello');console.log('code block');```- Math: $x = {-b \pm \sqrt{b^2-4ac} \over 2a}$ Charts Wowchemy supports the popular Plotly format for interactive charts.
Save your Plotly JSON in your page folder, for example line-chart.json, and then add the {{< chart data="line-chart" >}} shortcode where you would like the chart to appear.
Demo:
You might also find the Plotly JSON Editor useful.
Math Wowchemy supports a Markdown extension for $\LaTeX$ math. You can enable this feature by toggling the math option in your config/_default/params.yaml file.
To render inline or block math, wrap your LaTeX math with {{< math >}}$...${{< /math >}} or {{< math >}}$$...$${{< /math >}}, respectively. (We wrap the LaTeX math in the Wowchemy math shortcode to prevent Hugo rendering our math as Markdown. The math shortcode is new in v5.5-dev.)
Example math block:
{{< math >}} $$ \gamma_{n} = \frac{ \left | \left (\mathbf x_{n} - \mathbf x_{n-1} \right )^T \left [\nabla F (\mathbf x_{n}) - \nabla F (\mathbf x_{n-1}) \right ] \right |}{\left \|\nabla F(\mathbf{x}_{n}) - \nabla F(\mathbf{x}_{n-1}) \right \|^2} $$ {{< /math >}} renders as
$$\gamma_{n} = \frac{ \left | \left (\mathbf x_{n} - \mathbf x_{n-1} \right )^T \left [\nabla F (\mathbf x_{n}) - \nabla F (\mathbf x_{n-1}) \right ] \right |}{\left \|\nabla F(\mathbf{x}_{n}) - \nabla F(\mathbf{x}_{n-1}) \right \|^2}$$Example inline math {{< math >}}$\nabla F(\mathbf{x}_{n})${{< /math >}} renders as $\nabla F(\mathbf{x}_{n})$.
Example multi-line math using the math linebreak (\\):
{{< math >}} $$f(k;p_{0}^{*}) = \begin{cases}p_{0}^{*} & \text{if }k=1, \\ 1-p_{0}^{*} & \text{if }k=0.\end{cases}$$ {{< /math >}} renders as
$$f(k;p_{0}^{*}) = \begin{cases}p_{0}^{*} & \text{if }k=1, \\1-p_{0}^{*} & \text{if }k=0.\end{cases}$$Diagrams Wowchemy supports a Markdown extension for diagrams. You can enable this feature by toggling the diagram option in your config/_default/params.toml file or by adding diagram: true to your page front matter.
An example flowchart:
```mermaidgraph TDA[Hard] -->|Text| B(Round)B --> C{Decision}C -->|One| D[Result 1]C -->|Two| E[Result 2]```renders as
graph TDA[Hard] -->|Text| B(Round)B --> C{Decision}C -->|One| D[Result 1]C -->|Two| E[Result 2] An example sequence diagram:
```mermaidsequenceDiagramAlice->>John: Hello John, how are you?loop HealthcheckJohn->>John: Fight against hypochondriaendNote right of John: Rational thoughts!John-->>Alice: Great!John->>Bob: How about you?Bob-->>John: Jolly good!```renders as
sequenceDiagramAlice->>John: Hello John, how are you?loop HealthcheckJohn->>John: Fight against hypochondriaendNote right of John: Rational thoughts!John-->>Alice: Great!John->>Bob: How about you?Bob-->>John: Jolly good! An example Gantt diagram:
```mermaidganttsection SectionCompleted :done, des1, 2014-01-06,2014-01-08Active :active, des2, 2014-01-07, 3dParallel 1 : des3, after des1, 1dParallel 2 : des4, after des1, 1dParallel 3 : des5, after des3, 1dParallel 4 : des6, after des4, 1d```renders ‚Ä¶
summary:
Wowchemy is designed to give technical content creators a seamless experience. You can focus on the content and Wowchemy handles the rest.
Highlight your code snippets, take notes on math classes, and draw diagrams from textual representation.
title: Writing technical content in Markdown

content:
from IPython.core.display import Image Image('https://www.python.org/static/community_logos/python-logo-master-v3-TM-flattened.png') print("Welcome to Academic!") Welcome to Academic!Install Python and JupyterLab Install Anaconda which includes Python 3 and JupyterLab.
Alternatively, install JupyterLab with pip3 install jupyterlab.
Create or upload a Jupyter notebook Run the following commands in your Terminal, substituting <MY-WEBSITE-FOLDER> and <SHORT-POST-TITLE> with the file path to your Academic website folder and a short title for your blog post (use hyphens instead of spaces), respectively:
mkdir -p <MY-WEBSITE-FOLDER>/content/post/<SHORT-POST-TITLE>/ cd <MY-WEBSITE-FOLDER>/content/post/<SHORT-POST-TITLE>/ jupyter lab index.ipynb The jupyter command above will launch the JupyterLab editor, allowing us to add Academic metadata and write the content.
Edit your post metadata The first cell of your Jupter notebook will contain your post metadata (front matter).
In Jupter, choose Markdown as the type of the first cell and wrap your Academic metadata in three dashes, indicating that it is YAML front matter:
--- title: My post's title date: 2019-09-01 # Put any other Academic metadata here... --- Edit the metadata of your post, using the documentation as a guide to the available options.
To set a featured image, place an image named featured into your post‚Äôs folder.
For other tips, such as using math, see the guide on writing content with Academic.
Convert notebook to Markdown jupyter nbconvert index.ipynb --to markdown --NbConvertApp.output_files_dir=. Example This post was created with Jupyter. The orginal files can be found at https://github.com/gcushen/hugo-academic/tree/master/exampleSite/content/post/jupyter
summary: Learn how to blog in Academic using Jupyter notebooks
title: Display Jupyter Notebooks with Academic

content:
Create slides in Markdown with Wowchemy Wowchemy | Documentation
Features Efficiently write slides in Markdown 3-in-1: Create, Present, and Publish your slides Supports speaker notes Mobile friendly slides Controls Next: Right Arrow or Space Previous: Left Arrow Start: Home Finish: End Overview: Esc Speaker notes: S Fullscreen: F Zoom: Alt + Click PDF Export Code Highlighting Inline code: variable
Code block:
porridge = "blueberry" if porridge == "blueberry": print("Eating...") Math In-line math: $x + y = z$
Block math:
$$ f\left( x \right) = ;\frac{{2\left( {x + 4} \right)\left( {x - 4} \right)}}{{\left( {x + 4} \right)\left( {x + 1} \right)}} $$
Fragments Make content appear incrementally
{{% fragment %}} One {{% /fragment %}} {{% fragment %}} **Two** {{% /fragment %}} {{% fragment %}} Three {{% /fragment %}} Press Space to play!
One Two Three A fragment can accept two optional parameters:
class: use a custom style (requires definition in custom CSS) weight: sets the order in which a fragment appears Speaker Notes Add speaker notes to your presentation
{{% speaker_note %}} - Only the speaker can read these notes - Press `S` key to view {{% /speaker_note %}} Press the S key to view the speaker notes!
Only the speaker can read these notes Press S key to view Themes black: Black background, white text, blue links (default) white: White background, black text, blue links league: Gray background, white text, blue links beige: Beige background, dark text, brown links sky: Blue background, thin dark text, blue links night: Black background, thick white text, orange links serif: Cappuccino background, gray text, brown links simple: White background, black text, blue links solarized: Cream-colored background, dark green text, blue links Custom Slide Customize the slide style and background
{{< slide background-image="/media/boards.jpg" >}} {{< slide background-color="#0000FF" >}} {{< slide class="my-style" >}} Custom CSS Example Let‚Äôs make headers navy colored.
Create assets/css/reveal_custom.css with:
.reveal section h1, .reveal section h2, .reveal section h3 { color: navy; } Questions? Ask
Documentation
summary: An introduction to using Wowchemy's Slides feature.
title: Slides
